ygData.subject: Why is FetchHTTP using HTTP/1.0 and not HTTP/1.1?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I d like to use archive-crawler for one of my projects. However, to efficiently update a crawl run, I d like to use some of the HTTP/1.1 features

From: "Michael Scharf" <Michael_Scharf@...>
Subject: Why is FetchHTTP using HTTP/1.0 and not HTTP/1.1?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=87661776; y=fgLeQ7sdfuTcdHDRukHP18_JsOLqBZ3v5tMCT_lr1DrMRJo0RR3GRwM
X-Yahoo-Profile: michael_scharf

Hi,

I'd like to use archive-crawler for one of my
projects. However, to efficiently update a crawl run, I'd
like to use some of the HTTP/1.1 features 
(http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html).

In particular, I am interested in using the ETag
response(http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-
sec14.html#sec14.19)
together with If-None-Match 
(http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.25)
and If-Modified-Since (http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-
sec14.html#sec14.25).

The basic idea would be, to store the ETag and the date of a
fetched URL. In the next crawl I would only fetch urls that
have changed.

Am I missing something here, or are there implied
disadvantages to use HTTP/1.1 and to use that approach?

Or is there another mechanism to efficiently update a crawl
that I have missed?

Or does someone know another java crawler that uses HTTP/1.1?

Michael
